description: Species of the sample

description: Anatomical part of the organism

usage: default, human, cell-lines, single-cell, immunopeptidomics, crosslinking, dia-acquisition, dda-acquisition
description: Disease state of the sample (use 'normal' from PATO for healthy samples)

usage: minimum, default, human, cell-lines, single-cell, immunopeptidomics, crosslinking, metaproteomics, dia-acquisition, dda-acquisition
description: Cell type of the sample

usage: minimum, default, human, cell-lines, single-cell, immunopeptidomics, crosslinking, metaproteomics, dia-acquisition, dda-acquisition
values: fixed: tissue, cell, cell line, organism part, whole organism, synthetic
description: Type of biological material being analyzed (derived from MAGE-TAB specification)

usage: minimum, default, human, cell-lines, single-cell, immunopeptidomics, crosslinking, metaproteomics, dia-acquisition, dda-acquisition
description: Identifier for the biological replicate
Ancestry or ethnic background of the donor
Age of the donor at sample collection

values: fixed: male, female, intersex, anonymized, not available, not applicable, pooled
description: Biological sex of the donor
Developmental stage of the donor
Unique identifier for the donor individual
Name of the cell line
Cellosaurus accession number for the cell line
Official Cellosaurus name for the cell line
Specific sampling location within organism part (e.g., tumor, normal tissue adjacent to tumor, left ventricle). Use to distinguish tissue contexts.
Disease progression stage (stage I-IV, chronic phase, end stage). Distinct from tumor-specific staging.
Histological tumor grade (grade 1-4). Describes how abnormal cells look.
TNM staging notation (T0-4, N0-3, M0-1). Describes extent of cancer spread.
Free-text clinical details (receptor status, treatment history, surgical details). Use for context not captured in structured fields.
Relevant medical history information for the patient.

usage: default, human, cell-lines, vertebrates, invertebrates, plants
description: Observable characteristics or traits (drug sensitivity, molecular markers, expression phenotypes, environmental responses). Captures how sample behaves/appears.
Location where cancer has spread from primary site.
Patient survival time for survival analysis studies.
Tumor size measurement (e.g., 2.5 cm).
Tumor mass/weight measurement.
Specific anatomical location of biopsy.
Time of last clinical follow-up for longitudinal studies.
Duration of treatment exposure (e.g., 24 hour, 5 days).
Method of genetic modification (knockout, knockdown, overexpression, transduction). Describes HOW modification was done.
Chemical compound or drug applied to sample. Use ChEBI ontology for standardization.
Dose or concentration of compound treatment.
Pre-existing medical conditions or comorbidities.

values: fixed: pre-treatment, on treatment, post-treatment, treatment naive
description: Treatment status at time of sampling.
Response to treatment (complete response, partial response, progressive disease).
Body mass index (BMI) in kg/m^2.

values: fixed: never smoker, former smoker, current smoker
description: Patient smoking status.
Menopausal status for female patients.
Breast cancer molecular subtype (luminal A, luminal B, HER2-enriched, triple-negative).

values: fixed: FACS, microfluidics, laser capture microdissection, manual picking, CellenONE, nanoPOTS
description: Method used to isolate single cells
Unique identifier for the single cell
Viability status of the cell at isolation

values: fixed: G1, S, G2, M, G0
description: Cell cycle phase of the isolated cell
Markers used for cell sorting/selection
Genotype of the organism (for model organisms)
Strain or genetic background of model organisms

values: fixed: MHC class I, MHC class II, MHC class I and II
description: MHC class targeted for immunopeptidome enrichment

values: fixed: immunoaffinity purification, mild acid elution, detergent lysis
description: Method used to enrich MHC-bound peptides
HLA alleles expressed by the sample

values: fixed: NGS-based typing, SSO typing, SSP typing, SBT typing, predicted from RNA-seq
description: Method used for HLA typing
Name of the cross-linking reagent used

values: fixed: enrichment of cross-linked peptides, not applicable
description: Indicates if the sample was enriched for cross-linked peptides

values: fixed: homo-bifunctional, hetero-bifunctional, zero-length, photo-reactive, cleavable
description: Type of crosslinks being studied
Maximum distance constraint provided by the crosslinker
Duration of the crosslinking reaction
Temperature at which crosslinking was performed
Type of environmental sample analyzed
Method used to collect the environmental sample
Geographic location where sample was collected
Date when sample was collected
Depth at which sample was collected
Temperature at sampling location
pH at sampling location
Host organism for host-associated microbiome samples
Disease state of the host organism

description: Name of the raw data file
Post-translational modifications searched
Precursor mass tolerance for database search
Fragment mass tolerance for database search
Precursor mass range for database search (e.g., 800:2500)
Precursor charge range for database search (e.g., 1:3)
Passage number of the cell line
Repository or source from which the cell line was obtained
Method used to authenticate the cell line identity
Carrier proteome used in carrier-assisted SCP methods
TMT channel used for carrier proteome
TMT channel used for reference/booster
Number of cells per well/reaction

values: fixed: OK, pass, fail, not OK
description: Quality assessment of the single cell preparation
Number of cells used for immunopeptidome extraction
Mass of tissue used for immunopeptidome extraction
Antibody clone used for MHC immunoprecipitation
Conditions used for peptide elution from MHC complexes

values: fixed: cross-linking mass spectrometry, hydrogen-deuterium exchange, ion-mobility mass spectrometry
description: MS-based cross-linking methodology used
Cross-linker compound with structured properties
Concentration of crosslinking reagent used
Molar ratio of crosslinker to protein
Reagent used to quench the crosslinking reaction

values: fixed: size exclusion chromatography, strong cation exchange, affinity enrichment, peptide SEC, high-pH reversed phase, FAIMS
description: Method used to enrich crosslinked peptides

values: fixed: matched metagenome, reference database, two-step search, spectral library
description: Strategy used for protein database searching
Accession number for matched metagenome data
Storage conditions for the sample before analysis
Lower m/z limit of the DIA scan window
Upper m/z limit of the DIA scan window
Width of the isolation window in m/z units

values: pattern: {value} {unit} where value is number with optional %, unit is NCE or eV. Stepped: {value} {unit};{value} {unit}
description: Collision energy used for fragmentation. Examples: 30 NCE, 30% NCE, 27 eV, 25 NCE;27 NCE;30 NCE
Fragmentation method used
Mass analyzer used for MS2 acquisition
Specific DIA method variant used
Peptide fractionation method used before MS analysis
